Python Video Recorder (pyvr)¶

Functions¶

Routines that can be used to simplify or remove the interaction with the classes

record(filename_no_ext)[source]¶
About:

This is the main entrypoint to the pyvr package. It is likely the only function you will use. Call it to record video and audio from you system.

Parameters:

filename_no_ext (str) – The name of the resulting file (without the .mkv extension). This filename will be used to create 2 intermediate files (one .wav and one .mp4) that are combined after the recording is complete into the .mkv file.

Side Effect:

Creation of a .mkv file recording the requested audio and video.

Return type:

None

Note

This routine makes a great example of how to interact with the classes in this package.

Sample Code using the AudioRecorder and VideoRecorder classes.¶
    with VideoCard() as vc:
        with VideoRecorder("video.mp4", vc):
            with AudioInput(input_name="Pyle") as ai:
                with AudioRecorder(ai, filename="audio.wav"):
                    while True:
                        f = vc.most_recent_frame()
                        cv2.imshow("Preview", f)

                        keypress = cv2.waitKey(1)
                        if keypress & 0xFF == ord('q'):
                            break
combine_video_and_audio(video_file, audio_file, resulting_file)[source]¶
About:

Routine to combine a video file (with no audio) and an audio file into a single file using the H.265 codec creating a that is as small as possible without losing its quality.

Parameters:

  • video_file (str) – filename of the video file as a string (must end in .mp4)

  • audio_file (str) – filename of the audio file as a string (must end in .wav)

  • resulting_file (str) – store the resulting combined file in this filename (must end in .mkv)

Side Effect:

Creation of a .mkv file recording the requested audio and video.

Return type:

None

Classes¶

AudioInput

    Author: Jeffery Alkire
    Date:   October 2023
class AudioInput(sample_size=8)[source]¶

An AudioInput object will start a thread that will monitor the audio stream of a linux audio input device. It is designed to work with a with clause.

See also

Code snippet from record(...)

__init__(sample_size=8)[source]¶
About:

AudioInput constructor

Parameters:

sample_size (int) – how many bits to use for each sample. This value should be a pulse audio constant (paInt8, paInt16, paInt24, paInt32). Passing 16 will probably not get you a 16-bit sample size.

get_latest_audio()[source]¶
About:

obtain the latest audio data the input device has provided.

Return type:

bytes

Returns:

the binary audio data to be saved in the audio file.

listen()[source]¶
About:

Code executed by the audio-capture-thread. Constantly examine the audio from the input device and save it to a file when it is available.

Return type:

None

new_audio_avail()[source]¶
About:

determine if the recorder has unsaved data.

Return type:

bool

Returns:

TRUE if it is time to save some data, FALSE if not.

start_listening()[source]¶
About:

Start monitoring this device and storing the audio data locally. This will start a thread devoted to the process and then return.

Return type:

None

stop_listening()[source]¶
About:

Complete the monitoring of audio input device and terminate the corresponding thread.

Return type:

None

AudioRecorder

    Author: Jeffery Alkire
    Date:   October 2023
class AudioRecorder(audio_input, filename)[source]¶

An AudioRecorder object will start a thread that will monitor and record chunks of audio frames supplied by a AudioInput object.

See also

Code snippet from record(...)

__init__(audio_input, filename)[source]¶
About:

AudioRecorder constructor

Parameters:

  • audio_input (AudioInput) –

  • filename (str) – Filename used to store audio recording. Currently only .wav files are supported.

record()[source]¶
About:

Routine run from the AudioRecorder’s thread. This thread monitors the status of the AudioInput device and saves the audio data as it becomes available.

Return type:

None

start_recording()[source]¶
About:

Start a new thread and use it to record (write to disk) the audio data retreived from the AudioInput object.

Return type:

None

stop_recording()[source]¶
About:

Complete recording and stop the thread doing it.

Return type:

None

VideoCard

    Author: Jeffery Alkire
    Date:   October 2023
class VideoCard(specs=('/dev/video0', 720, 1280))[source]¶

A VideoCard object will start a thread that will monitor the video stream of a linux video device. It is designed to work with a with clause.

See also

Code snippet from record(...)

__init__(specs=('/dev/video0', 720, 1280))[source]¶
About:

VideoCard object constructor.

Parameters:

specs (VideoReadSpecs) – device and screen size of the video capture device.

frame_loader()[source]¶
About:

Code executed by the video-capture-thread. Constantly examine the video from the card and store it locally.

Return type:

None

most_recent_frame()[source]¶
About:

Get the most recently captured frame from the video capture device. Used to view or record the contents of the video stream.

Return type:

bytes

Returns:

binary image as captured by the video capture device.

start_viewing()[source]¶
About:

Start monitoring this device and storing the video images locally. This will start a thread devoted to the process and then return.

Return type:

None

stop_viewing()[source]¶
About:

Complete the monitoring of video capture device and terminate the corresponding thread..

Return type:

None

class VideoReadSpecs(device, height, width)¶

Named tuple used to pass the necessary information about the video device to the VideoCard object so that it can properly retreive the video data.

device¶

Alias for field number 0

height¶

Alias for field number 1

width¶

Alias for field number 2

VideoRecorder

    Author: Jeffery Alkire
    Date:   October 2023
class VideoRecorder(filename, card, specs=<pyvr.VideoRecorder.VideoRecorderSpecs object>)[source]¶

A VideoRecorder object will start a thread that will monitor and record video frames supplied by VideoCard

See also

Code snippet from record(...)

__init__(filename, card, specs=<pyvr.VideoRecorder.VideoRecorderSpecs object>)[source]¶
About:

VideoRecorder constructor

Parameters:

  • filename (str) – filename (currently must end with .mp4) to record video to.

  • card (VideoCard) – object used to retrieve the video frames from the hardware.

  • specs (VideoRecorderSpecs) – setup parameters for this recorder object. Things like the codec to use to record (only “mp4v” currently supported) the video and the speed (fps) to record at.

next_frame(frame)[source]¶
About:

get a copy of the next frame to be saved to disk.

Note:

The frame is only cached at this point. It will be saved to disk only when it is time (based on the fps). This insures the recording is taken at the correct speed.

Return type:

bool

Returns:

Return TRUE if the next frame was accepted and FALSE if it is too soon.

ready_for_new_frame()[source]¶
About:

determine if the recorder is able to store the next video frame.

Return type:

bool

record()[source]¶
About:

Routine run from the VideoRecorder’s thread. This thread monitors the passage of time recording the proper number of frames each second.

Note:

A log entry is written at the conclusion of recording indicating the speed of the recording.

Return type:

None

record_next_frame_at(start)[source]¶
About:

Determine the time the next frame should be recorded.

Parameters:

start (float) – the time the video recording began (in seconds)

Return type:

float

Returns:

the results of a simple calculation of the time the next frame should be saved. (in seconds)

start_recording()[source]¶
About:

Start a new thread and use it to record (write to disk) the video frames retreived from the VideoCard

Return type:

None

stop_recording()[source]¶
About:

Complete recording and stop the thread doing it.

Return type:

None

class VideoRecorderSpecs(fps=30, codec='mp4v')[source]¶

Class used to pass relevant settings to the VideoRecorder object so that it can properly record the video to disk.

__init__(fps=30, codec='mp4v')[source]¶
About:

VideoRecorderSpecs constructor

Parameters:

  • fps (int) – frames to record during each second.

  • codec (str) – Codec to use while recording.
